docs.snippet: Lee Unkrich, the director of "Toy Story 3," says working at Pixar comes with its challenges, and they're not all of the adorable, heart-tugging kind....
docs.lead_paragraph: If you've taken the behind-the-scenes tour of Pixar Animation or read about what it's like to work there, you may think it's a non-stop fun factory. We were googly-eyed pretty much the entire time we were there.
docs.abstract: Lee Unkrich, the director of "Toy Story 3," says working at Pixar comes with its challenges, and they're not all of the adorable, heart-tugging kind.

headline.main: A Little Stress to Go With the Pixar Fun

docs.snippet: The Moment sat down with the odd couple of fashion to find out what exactly what makes them click....
docs.lead_paragraph: We live in an age of instant gratification, where everything our hearts desire - news, information, groceries - can be had with the click of a mouse. And starting on February 16 at 11 a.m., you can add fashion to that list. Yes, there are plenty of shopping sites out there, but Moda Operandi, a new e-tail concept from Lauren Santo Domingo and Aslaug Magnusdottir, will allow shoppers to see and purchase their favorite looks right off the runway.
docs.abstract: The Moment sat down with the odd couple of fashion to find out what exactly what makes them click.

headline.main: Asked & Answered | Lauren Santo Domingo and Aslaug Magnusdottir

docs.snippet: If the street artist Banksy wins an Oscar, he will not be allowed up on stage in his usual costume of monkey mask, the Academy has said....
docs.lead_paragraph: The will-he, won't-he riddle about Banksy and the Oscars - will he show up? won't he be in disguise? - has a solution. After the Oscar nominees luncheon on Monday, Steve Pond reports, the Academy president, Tom Sherak, and executive director, Bruce Davis, "huddled at a table" with Jaimie D'Cruz, a producer of "Exit Through the Gift Shop," Banksy's Oscar-nominated documentary. They worked through the potential situations of Banksy winning and having to appear on stage, which he would presumably do in costume, his costume of choice being a monkey mask. Undignified, the Academy felt. "If Banksy isn't comfortable showing his face on the Kodak stage, Sherak said, then the Academy isn't comfortable having him on that stage," Mr. Pond writes. Instead, the Academy officials and Mr. D'Cruz agreed, if the movie wins, Mr. D'Cruz will accept "without any additional shenanigans."
docs.abstract: If the street artist Banksy wins an Oscar, he will not be allowed up on stage in his usual costume of monkey mask, the Academy has said.

headline.main: Banksy Shenanigans Not Welcome at Oscars

docs.snippet: Warner Brothers has had a nightmarish Oscar season, but none of that is stopping the studio from making another campaign push for its dreamworld thriller....
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES- Warner Brothers has had a nightmarish Oscar season. First, "The Town" ran out of gas. Clint Eastwood's "Hereafter" didn't seem to have any to begin with. Then Christopher Nolan failed to get a directing nomination for "Inception." But none of that is stopping the studio from making another campaign push, doubling down on its dreamworld thriller.
docs.abstract: Warner Brothers has had a nightmarish Oscar season, but none of that is stopping the studio from making another campaign push for its dreamworld thriller.

(The post, which had been here, has moved to Carpetbagger, where it belongs in this awards season.)
